intro: Navarretia intertexta, commonly known as the Sierra snowplant, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine regions. Navarretia intertexta is adapted to cold climates and is an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
